fullDescription.intro:
This node lets you handle CDK molecules which are fragmented into different parts. This is useful because some algorithms won't work with unconnected structures. You have either the choice to completely remove the rows that contain fragmented molecules, or to remove all fragments except the biggest one.
This node can process the input table in parallel. However, by default the usage of threads is disabled in the CDK plugin, because the CDK code may not be thread-safe in all places. If you want to enable multi-threading, change the setting in the KNIME preferences.
fullDescription.option: Select the column containing the molecular structure
Removes all rows completely that contain a molecule with multiple fragments
Removes all fragments except the biggest from unconnected molecules
Adds a collection column that contains all fragments a molecule consists of

ports.outPort: As input but without unconnected molecules
